title: push_to_git_remote doesn't escape branch names
body:
### New Issue Checklist - [x] Updated fastlane to the latest version - [x] I read the [Contribution Guidelines](https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) - [x] I read [docs.fastlane.tools](https://docs.fastlane.tools) - [x] I searched for [existing GitHub issues](https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/issues) ### Issue Description push_to_git_remote seems to not be escaping parameters The git command is constructed as follows ``` command = [ ‚Äògit‚Äô, ‚Äòpush‚Äô, params[:remote], ‚Äú#{local_branch}:#{remote_branch}‚Äù ] ``` I believe that the branch names should be escaped as follows `‚Äú'#{local_branch}':'#{remote_branch}'‚Äù ` The issue being that pushing a branch named `release-1.0.0(1)` to the git remote fails with `bash: syntax error near unexpected token `('` ##### Complete output when running fastlane, including the stack trace and command used 
[INSERT OUTPUT HERE]
### Environment 
üö´ fastlane environment üö´

| --------------------------- | ------------------------------------------- |

| Installation Source         | ~/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.2.5/bin/fastlane         |

| Is installed via Fabric.app | false                                       |
| Xcode Path                  | /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/ |
| Xcode Version               | 10.0                                        |
